definition: internal affairs/domestic affairs/family affairs/(trad.) affairs within the palace
inside/inner/internal/within/interior
affair/business/matter/to be engaged in/to attend to/by all means
Ministry of Internal Affairs
Imperial Household Department (in Qing dynasty)

sentences.english: Those run by the Interior and Defense Ministries are worse, he said.
sentences.chinese: 而由內務部和國防部管轄的其他監獄狀況糟糕，他說。

sentences.english: A House committee approved this approach last week; the full House could pass it this week.
sentences.chinese: 內務委員會上週通過此提案，衆議院此周也有望通過。

sentences.english: Some tenants come short of a desirable standard in housekeeping and tidiness.
sentences.chinese: 一些租戶在內務和整潔方面缺乏可取的標準。

sentences.english: Kyrgyz Interior Ministry forces search a neighborhood in Osh.
sentences.chinese: 吉國內務部隊在奧什地區挨戶搜查。

sentences.english: The center hole will house the center guide tube that you can also see in the background.
sentences.chinese: 中心孔會內務中心指導管，您也可以看到，在背景中。

sentences.english: New recruits are back to the dormitory was his commander ordered to sort out the interior.
sentences.chinese: 新兵們回到宿舍又被分隊長命令整理內務。

sentences.english: Or perhaps Representative Darrell Issa, chair of the House Committee on Oversight?
sentences.chinese: 或者也許是內務委員會監管主席達雷爾伊薩議員？

sentences.english: Hantavirus can only affect those individuals working in housekeeping.
sentences.chinese: 漢他病毒隻影響那些個人在內務管理工作。

sentences.english: Shota Uteashvili is a spokesman for Georgia's Internal Ministry.
sentences.chinese: 格魯吉亞內務部發言人烏圖阿什維利說。

definition: low ranking/low level/underclass/subordinate
to relieve sb of his post/to sack/to demote/dismissal/sacking
the Kempeitai or Japanese Military Police 1881-1945 (Japanese counterpart of the Gestapo during WWII)
to assign (a task to sb)
workplace overseer/foreman
specialized agency
to watch with folded arms (idiom); to look on without lifting a finger
everything clear and orderly (idiom); neat and tidy
security measures (esp. border security)/official seal (esp. military seal during Qing and Ming times)
staff officer/to give advice
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
to sign/to make one's mark
Ministry of Foreign Affairs in Qing Dynasty
junior high school (Tw)/abbr. to 國中|国中[guo2 zhong1]
funds and provisions for the troops/(soldier's) pay
law and order/rules and discipline
